extends java.lang.Object

    Implementation of the physics engine
    Author:
    Tom Wu and Roxanne Baker

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(ILevel universe,
                   double dt)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicsEngine
        Update Positions of IEntities in universe based on dt and their Velocities
        Specified by:
        update in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        universe - IEntitySystem containing IEntities with both Positions and Velocities
        dt - duration of update in seconds

      • applyImpulse

        public boolean applyImpulse(IEntity body,
                            Vector impulse)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicsEngine
        Useful for debugging but will be deprecated! Applies impulse J to IEntity body
        Specified by:
        applyImpulse in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        body - IEntity with Mass, Position, and Velocity
        impulse - Impulse vector used to calculate the updated Velocity
        Returns:
        whether J is successfully applied to body (false if body does not have Mass, Position, and Velocity)

      • applyGravity

        public void applyGravity(ILevel universe,
                         double secondsPassed)

      • applyCollisions

        public void applyCollisions(ILevel universe,
                            boolean dynamicsOn)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicsEngine
        Marks Collision IComponents of applicable IEntities in universe with appropriate collidingIDs
        Specified by:
        applyCollisions in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        universe - IEntitySystem containing IEntities with both Positions and Collisions
        dynamicsOn - if true, then impulses are subsequently applied to applicable IEntities (with Mass, Position, Velocity, and of course, Collision)
